intro: Tristagma narcissoides, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are yellow with five petals and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in dry grasslands and along riverbanks, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
